intro: Bossiaea stephensonii, commonly known as the pink bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive pink to red flowers that appear in late summer to autumn. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with small, elliptical leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun, making it a hardy species suitable for coastal and sandy environments. The flowers are pollinated by birds, particularly honeyeaters, contributing to its ecological significance in native habitats.
